Package Model

Class FileManager

java.lang.Object
Model.FileManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
DataBase
public class FileManager extends Object
FileManager is responsible for managing the reading and writing of files and also handles the string representations when saving files.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FileManager()
    Sets the setFilePath to the path where the program is run in.

  • Constructor Details

    • FileManager

      public FileManager()
      Sets the setFilePath to the path where the program is run in. This is why running the program from a terminal based in another folder does not work.

  • Method Details

    • createTextFile

      public void createTextFile(Path path) throws Exception
      Creates a file with a given name. If the creation fails, an exception gets thrown.
      Parameters:
      path - The path where the text file should be created .
      Throws:
      Exception

    • createTextFile

      public void createTextFile(String name) throws Exception
      Creates textfile with given name inside /Sets/.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the set that should be created.
      Throws:
      Exception - Forwards exception from File.createNewFile().

    • deleteTextFile

      public void deleteTextFile(String setName) throws IOException
      Deletes the textfile with the name setName. (setType.setName)
      Parameters:
      setName -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • createTextFile

      public void createTextFile(String name, String folderName) throws Exception
      Creates textfile with given name inside /Sets/folderName/.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the set that should be created.
      folderName - The name of the folder inside /Sets/ where the textfile should be created.
      Throws:
      Exception - Forwards exception from File.createNewFile().

    • createFolder

      public void createFolder(String name) throws IOException
      Creates a folder in /Sets/. Sets can be saved inside these folders. Cannot create a folder inside a folder.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the folder.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • writeFile

      public void writeFile(String fileName, String content) throws Exception
      Writes a string to a text file in the default sets folder.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the entire name of the textfile that should be written. (setType.setName)
      content - the string that should be written to the textfile.
      Throws:
      Exception - Forwards Files.writeString() exception.

    • writeFile

      public void writeFile(String fileName, String folder, String content) throws Exception
      Writes a string to a text file in the default sets folder.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the entire name of the textfile that should be written. (setType.setName)
      content - the string that should be written to the textfile.
      folder - The folder in which the file that should be written to exists.
      Throws:
      Exception - Forwards Files.writeString() exception.

    • readFile

      public Set readFile(String textFileName) throws Exception
      Reads the text file with the given name inside /Sets/.
      Parameters:
      textFileName - The filename of the text file that should be read. (setType.setName)
      Returns:
      Returns the corresponding set read from the file.
      Throws:
      Exception - Forwards readFile(Path) exception.

    • readFile

      public Set readFile(String textFileName, String folderName) throws Exception
      Reads a file inside a given folder.
      Parameters:
      textFileName - The filename of the text file that should be read. (setType.setName)
      folderName - The name of the folder in which the file that should be read exists.
      Returns:
      Returns the corresponding set read from the file.
      Throws:
      Exception - Forwards readFile(Path) exception.

    • saveSet

      public void saveSet(Set set, Path path) throws Exception
      Saves the given set to a textfile in the right format.
      Parameters:
      set - the set that gets written to a file.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • saveSet

      public void saveSet(Set set) throws Exception
      Uses saveSet(Set,Path).
      Parameters:
      set - The set that gets written to a file.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • getNamesOfSets

      public ArrayList<String> getNamesOfSets(Path path)
      Returns an ArrayList of the names of all sets in the given folder, this method is recursive and also returns the names of the sets in folders. NO TAIL RECURSION
      Parameters:
      path - - the path in which to look for folders.
      Returns:
      Returns an arraylist of Strings representing the names of sets inside a folder. This includes sets inside folders.

    • getAllSets

      public ArrayList<Set> getAllSets(Path path)
      Goes through all sets in folder path and calls recursively on folders.
      Parameters:
      path - The path that should be read.
      Returns:
      Returns a list of all sets inside folder and child folders of directory.

    • getAllSets

      public ArrayList<Set> getAllSets()
      Runs getAllSets with setFilePath as argument.
      Returns:
      Returns all sets from the Sets folder in an array.

    • getNamesOfSets

      public ArrayList<String> getNamesOfSets()
      Runs getNameOfSets with setFilePath as argument.
      Returns:
      the result of getNamesOfSets(setFilePath)

    • getTypeStringRepresentation

      public String getTypeStringRepresentation(Set set)
      Gets the string representation of the given set. ("fs" = flash set, "ss" = spelling set, "mcs" = multiple choice set)
      Parameters:
      set - The set to get the type of.
      Returns:
      Returns the string representation of the type of the set.
